channel.title: Log Out Problem
channel.description: I have a problem on my server FireScape. It runs fine, lag free will hold lots of people, but then when someone logs off while the server is running, they can't get in until I restart the server. Does anyone know how I could fix this? Thanks.

item.title: Log Out Problem
item.dc:creator: @KiIIer KiIIer
item.description:
@KiIIer wrote:

Wow thanks for the help!

Read full topic

item.title: Log Out Problem
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Make it from “PlayerHandler” to “playerHandler”

Read full topic

item.title: Log Out Problem
item.dc:creator: @KiIIer KiIIer
item.description:
@KiIIer wrote:

server.java:155: non-static method newPlayerClient(java.net.Socket,java.lang.Str ing) cannot be referenced from a static context PlayerHandler.newPlayerClient(s, connectingHost); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .
help please?

Read full topic

item.title: Log Out Problem
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

That is probably because too many people tried to log on, and it caused an OutOfMemoryError. Once that happens, then it wont let people back on because of the INSANELY crappy way it’s programmed. So what you do is find this line in server.java

PlayerHandler.newPlayerClient(s);

It may not use s, or it may be slightly different, I don’t really give a care, just change it to this

try{ PlayerHandler.newPlayerClient(s); }catch(Throwable throwable){ throwable.printStackTrace(); continue; }

Read full topic
